Summary Heading: Disappointed with the basic services provided
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel and was extremely disappointed with the level of service provided by the hotel policy. The sheets, towels, and garbage in my room were not changed during my 4 days stay. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk, they were unresponsive and did not take any action to rectify the situation.  Additionally, the overall cleanliness of the room was lacking and I don’t see any cleaning service staff around in this hotel.The air conditioning and heating in the room were too loud making it difficult to sleep comfortable.  I was extremely dissatisfied with the service provided by this hotel and would not recommend it to others. It is clear that the management and staff do not take guest satisfaction seriously and do not maintain the basic
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have traveled to & from this hotel the entire pandemic. It struggled like everyone else early on. But this last Feb. trip really displayed how they are rebounding. Every staff responded with such professionalism when needed. Their staff are certainly keeping this hotel successful & open. Looking forward to our next trip with them.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for two nights and the hotel exceeded my expectations. We have stayed in lots of hotels across America and have learned never to trust the photos so we are always nervous about what we might find once we check in.  We booked a king room and the room  was very large with a comfy couch and tv. The room was really clean and had everything we needed, mini fridge, lots of power points and hot showers.   The area seemed very safe and there is plenty of car parking. The hotel is only 15mins from the beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for a week.  The room was clean with 2 queen beds.  The staff was pleasant when I asked them to help with maintenance issues.  I appreciated the drinking water in the fitness centre.  The room had a tv with network cable.  The wifi was good enough for youtube but we kept losing it and had to log in.  We did not sign up for membership to get premium internet.  There was a pool which we did not use.  Maintenance issues were responded timely.  We walked to a grocery store half an hour away.  We saw a few restaurants nearby.  We would return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Looks much better in the pictures
Summary: For the price this hotel is not bad, however overall it could use better cleaning and upkeep. The front desk was somewhat unfriendly, they do the job but without any kind of joy whatsoever. The amenities work but that's it. For example, sink space was so minimal I could barely fit my toothbrush on it. Lights in the shower are bright and not dimmable, just feels cheap. Safety - the area did not feel very safe. Signed in parking lot warning you that management is not responsible and not to leave anything valuable in the car. btw- that did not stop them for charging $10 for parking. I expect if you collect parking fee at least have an automated gate or some fence for protection. General cleanness - I found candy wraps behind the bed, and it wasn't because I was looking for it,
Room tip: You get what you pay for in the rooms. If you choose a cheap room you get a parking lot view and...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel I have EVER stayed at!!!
Summary: Im from Fountain Valley and came home from Colorado to visit family here. I stayed here when it was new and was then the courtyard my Marriott. It is really run down. I checked in with Chris. When I went to my room the door had issues and it took 6-7 pulling down the handle from the inside just to close once! i also didn't not have internet and am in a Masters program with USC and had to be in a online class. I called down and Chris didn't have the time of day for me with either issue saying he is busy checking in a guest and would not help me. I went to the front desk and Chris still would not address the 2 problems saying I just need to figure it out???!!! Not great customer service at ALL! He then called his manager Mario who tried to help me with internet issue as I didn't
Room tip: no good rooms. walls are thin and you hear everything, doors don't close
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was supposed to stay 12/23 - 12/30, but left 12/29.  This place has really gone downhill!!  We have been staying here exclusively since 2105, but we won't be staying here again. I loved the convenience of having a kitchen, but at $1,205 for the stay & it now seems overpriced.   Especially since they no longer do the breakfast buffet - which is understandable with Covid & the CA restrictions; HOWEVER, the crappy "brown-bag" breakfast is horrible.  They don't ask what you want OR offer 2nd/3rd options.    Example: 1 pre-packaged banana-nut muffin, 8oz Nestle water, 1 small, bruised red apple, 1 brown sugar chewy granola bar (so much sugar-gross).  My husband has a nut allergy and is doing keto (almost 60 lbs lost - good for him!!)  So basically you can eat this unhealthy/dangerous
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose a suite. They do look like they have been remodeled. The suite was loaded. Full refrigerator, dishes, utensils, paper towels. Very clean inside the unit and good location to restaurants and amenities. Very quiet as well.  A few negatives are the bed and pillows have seen better days. The outdoor furniture is worn and dirty and people go out there to smoke. For a short stay it is fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us. your comments are appreciated and help us improve service.

Summary: Recommendation. Choose another property as this one isn’t worth the trouble. Room was fair. No extras due to COVID and nothing extra at all if you’re Bonvoy elite. Not even a bottle of water (4$). My favorite part of the stay was waiting patiently in line for checkout the next morning. One person ahead of me finishes up. I’m next right? Think again, calls start coming in to the front desk and rather than place the calls on hold for the next person standing in line (me), before their call was made, front desk employee decides to keep me waiting. After 3 calls handled before me I had enough. Turned in the keys and walked out, though not before front desk employee asks me what my problem is and sarcastically wishes me a nice day. No way to treat your customer during these difficult
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value...15 minute drive to the beach
Summary: Decided on the Courtyard for our Labor Day vacation visiting Huntington Beach. Hotel is good location right off the 405 FWY and 15 minute drive to Huntington Beach. The hotel is practicing COVID 19 procedures very well and we felt safe staying there. Rooms are little smaller than usually Marriotts but we were there to sleep and shower after long days at the beach. Parking is $10 a day but now most hotels are charging this nowadays. We like the shower soap dispenser and not the little plastics one that create waste. Room had fridge but no microwave. All in all we like this hotel in Fountain Valley and felt very welcomed by the staff especially Angel whose team was working hard this Labor Day weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Do not take expections of a clean room upon exiting and re-entering your room by end of day
Summary: I have asked too many times to have the soap and shampoo added to our room multiple times before just going to a store to buy a bottle and Irish spring myself to stock during my stay.  Surprise that California natives do pick up after their pets more so than Colorado natives. During a pandemic, there were too many guests enjoying breakfast while also coughing. So we ate in our rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went to Huntington Beach for the weekend to run a race and the prices in Huntington Beach proper are absurd.  This property is so conveniently located, easy 15 min max drive to the beach with lots and lots of shopping centers and food nearby, all with parking (a premium the closer you get to the ocean).  Hotel was quiet, room was well lit and comfortable.  Beds were nice, good water pressure in shower.  Fridge in room is helpful.  There is a pool and fitness center but we didn't use them.  Very please with price and convenience.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope this race was your best time yet.  We look forward to seeing you next year.

Summary: My rate included breakfast for two adults and two kids!!!!   The bistro guy would only allow me to pick one item.  Huh???? The TV in the bedroom was DOA. They did not send someone to fix it, even after I called.   Unbelievable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know of your experience.  Our goal is to ensure all guests have a pleasant, enjoyable stay and I apologize we failed to provide that during your visit.  I would also like to apologize for the lack of follow up concerning your television.    If you could provide any additional information concerning your reservation and encounters, it would allow me the opportunity to investigate further.    I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: We booked a room for one night as we were attending a party one evening and brunch the next. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful - every single one i encountered was great. The property has been there for a long time, and I was pleased to find it updated and very current in design and function. I was provided a room poolside, and it was roomy, clean and well appointed. free internet is always appreciated. It was really a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay.  We appreciate the positive feedback and hope to  have another opportunity to welcome you back in the near future.

Summary: I was only here for a night and since my flight was delayed, not a very long night.  The room was clean and had all the hotel amenities you would expect.  Since I got in so late, it took a while for the humidity to leave the room and the air to cool it down but other than that the room was quiet, dark and comfortable.  The cafe was a nice perk, especially for a business stay.  The breakfast sandwich was excellent and the egg white frittata was also delicious.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: arrived here because last minute changes, King room was SMALL.  Shower was a flat surface with glass doors, no tub in King room.  Pull out bed from couch was unbearable.  Front desk sent staff to provide sheets and blanket for the pull out bed, but still uncomfortable.  King bed was nice and comfortable , but the room was very cramped when using pull-out "bed" from the couch. For those reasons, had to change to 2 Queens room.  2 Queens room was Okay.  Blanket was flat did not have fluffiness of King blanket.  2Queens room had a shower over tub and curtain.  Liked the friendly and helpful front desk staff and housekeeping.  Breakfast staff was unfriendly.  The rate was too high in the mid $200.  Will inform family, friends and colleagues to explore other options as the rate we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know of your experience at our hotel. I am sorry to hear you had to change rooms, due to the limited space.   Some of our king rooms have the free standing shower, while others have bathtubs.  If you prefer a tub on a future stay, please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate your request.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: We had a 50th High School reunion nearby. The hotel accommodated us from out of town. Excellent accommodations, amenities,  and hospitality service. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Everyone was pleased!
Manager Response: Thanks you for staying with us.  We hope you had a memorable 50th High School Reunion and were able to reunite with some of your friends.   We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: Better than average Courtyard - the bed - OMG - the bed!
Summary: Courtyard (and most Marriott properties) are my go-to for no-frills, reliable comfort and efficiency (I generally have to work). Not sure if this is corporate-owned or a franchise, but they didn't skimp on the bed like some do. Parking is decent. Double-pane windows keep out the freeway noise. I do wonder about the height placement of the sink. It's taller than a kitchen table, making it a tiptoe rinse and spit for thie 5'4" woman. I would love to see a small shelf or cabinet in the toilet section (wipes, lotion, tissues, shower shoes, etc.). On the plus side, I'm thinking their visitor demo must run to the female because there was a makeup wipe in the soap dish. Keeps the linens cleaner, too. I like that. There's a crack in the sink in room 310, and I'll call it to staff's
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know how much you enjoyed your stay.  We are pleased that you slept so well and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: We stayed here for a spring break trip. Viraj upon check in and rest of the front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful! They gave us plenty of recommendations on restaurants/shops in the area. The hotel itself was convenient. Right off the high way and about a 10 min drive from the beach/shopping. The room was really nice/spacious and the beds were so comfy.
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and were able to visit the local area.  Viraj is a great asset to our team and I will be sure to pass on your comments.   Thank you again for staying with us.  We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: I was very concerned about staying at this hotel because of the negative reviews I had read about it. In fact, I tried to cancel my reservation but was denied a refund.  We were given a room on the third floor so that we could not hear walking above us. The walls are thin because you could hear the shower very clearly while in the bedroom.  However, the staff was very friendly and very accommodating when it came to replenishing supplies and helping us to orient ourselves in a new city.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback of your concerns as well as the friendliness of our team.  We hope you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: This courtyard is about par for the course in regards to the rest of the chain. It’s relatively nice, the staff is friendly and the rooms are spacious. Located within view of I-405, and many restaurants nearby. $8 on site parking it not a surprise for the area. The rate is better than I anticipated.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: No issues at all with this hotel.  It offered a clean room and comfortable bed.  Those are my "must-haves."  The front desk was very helpful with getting around the area. As i have seen commented on by others, the layout of the room (king bed) is such that it is hard to see the TV from the bed. There is better viewing from the couch.  I did hear some noise through the ceiling (walking around), but no street noise at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback on your recent stay.  We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary: I was in SoCal. for business meetings; starting off the week in the Los Angeles area and finishing off in Orange County area.  The gentleman that checked me in was polite; however, my request for a quiet room on upper floor room was not being honored.  I was placed in a room on the first room facing the outside parking area.  The size of a King room is average; what makes the room seem small is the bulky round sofa-bed, which is located between the end of the bed and the wall/window area.  The layout of the room is kind of weird: one cannot view TV from the bed, and must sit on the couch/sofa bed in order to watch TV.  In addition, the walls between rooms are very thin, as I can wear my neighbors’ conversation.   In comparison, I find the bathroom area rather roomy, with the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know of your recent stay.  I am sorry to hear of the room selection you were given after requesting a quiet room on an upper floor.  Although we try to accommodate our guest's requests, we failed in this instance and I again apologize. Thank you for your additional comments as well. We appreciate your feedback.   We hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back and ensure you have an enjoyable stay.

Summary: I stayed here because my house was being tented for termites.  It is close and it is located right off the freeway.  Positives:  Good sized room and nice pool  Negatives:  Noisy guest upstairs that continued to stomp around despite me calling the front desk, breakfast is not included despite the room costing $200, and you cannot checkout from your room.  If I have to stay locally again because work is being performed on my house, it will not be here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.    I am sorry to hear of the noise you experienced during your stay.  Please contact me at the hotel at 714-968-5775 if you would like to discuss this further.  Regards

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights, this week. My favorite part of the hotel is the outside area courtyard by the pool and fire pit.  Great seating area.  Inside in the lobby there is a pretty nice seating area with several styles of chairs and couches, and plenty of outlets for charging.  Cool little bar/bistro area with water, juice, fresh Starbucks, and alcohol.  Nice breakfast options for purchase.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was decent, walls are rather thin, I could hear the person in the next room talking on the phone. Bed was comfortable, loved the peppermint shampoo.  Lots of restaurants within a couple miles, not much in easy walking distance but there is a gas station right across the street.  Easy in and out. Could use some updates in rooms, but the friendly
Manager Response: none

Summary: Inconveniences no room microwave... $8 parking? Mechanical breakdown of elevator plus fighting couples all night... Very clean and close to 405...better options in Huntington ... property is family oriented
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback from your recent stay at  our hotel.  Please accept my sincere apology for the elevator breakdown  and the "fighting couple". This is not typical of our hotel and I hope you will allow us another opportunity to re-instill your faith in our hotel.    Regards,

Summary: First I want to say for overall comfort, the bed was the best by far!  My partner found a great deal with this Hotel and booked it from 6/30 - 7/3. I gave it 3 stars because what we were looking for was a place that had a full restaurant and bar and close to where we needed to be and so we didn't have to travel to go have breakfast, lunch, or dinner. From the description before booking, the info was misleading saying there was a restaurant and bar not a Bistro. (This might have been missed in translation) When staying at a Marriot Property one would expect room service, which there was not, considering there wasn't a full time restaurant. So since there wasn't room service, one would think a microwave in the room would have been perfect for reheating sandwiches and leftover
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback of your recent stay.  I am sorry the hotel did not have the full service conveniences you would have preferred, but hope you were able to enjoy your stay.  We appreciate your business and hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Nicely updated hotel, but beware...king rooms are really small
Summary: Stayed here for a softball tournament with my family.  We like to book a king with a pull-out sofa.  Quite surprised when we opened the door, the king was fine, but it was literally almost touching the sofa bed.  When the sofa bed is open, there is very little room to move.  Rooms are great for one or two people.  Was also surprised at how much noise could be heard in the rooms.    The bistro offers great breakfast food, but it not cheap, also you have to pay to park.  Wa
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback of your recent stay.  I understand your surprise at the size of the sleeper sofa.  Due to its design, it does take up more room than the previous model.  I apologize for the noise heard from other areas of the hotel and hope it did not prevent you from enjoying your stay.  Thank you again fro staying with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: After a poor experience with another hotel I was led to book a room with Courtyard and I was not disappointed. The hotel was updated, modern and very clean. The staff was complimentary and super friendly. The rooms was clean and had recently been remodeled. Bed was comfortable and had everything I needed.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us,  We are glad you were able to enjoy your stay and we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Summary: Came to OC for a short Disney trip with a few of my YMCA co-workers in Austin, Tx. The hotel is very updated and modern, which is good for a younger guests like us. Front desk at check in and check out were great! Cheryl was fantastic, very friendly! Very informative of the area, gave us a great restaurant recommendation. Jacobii at the bistro was nice as well. Definitely coming back to this hotel on my next disney trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If I knew about the parking fee and the no breakfast I would have booked at Ayres across the street.   It’s been a few years since we’ve been back to this hotel (we’ve stayed at Ayres since it opened) and it looks like it was recently renovated.  The room with double beds is small and so is the sink area.  It’s clean but I prefer the other one.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Courtyard Huntington Beach Fountain Valley and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.    Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. .   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Fountain Valley.

Summary: Stayed here one night. Room was clean, recently renovated. Lobby very trendy with lots of places to sit and relax. Enjoyed breakfast and Starbucks coffee in the morning. Right off 405 so convenient for travel
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: This is a great property .... near the 405 freeway. Priscilla and Ashley at the desk were awesome! All of the staff were very accommodating. The hotel was recently renovated I think ... it was all very clean. The lobby was very pretty. The water pressure in the room was great. Bed was comfortable. The only "con" was that there is no microwave in the room .... only a fridge. There was a very nice pool area  with fire pit at night. I would definitely stay again! : -)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay.  I am so glad we were able to accommodate you and provide a memorable experience.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Summary: My home was being painted and realized we have no access to beds for the night. We booked a last minute stay here assuming basic needs would be met: shower cap, body lotion, etc. When we left our home in disarray and everything covered in plastic, I assumed the hotel would be up to basic business standards with USB ports available for charging our cell phones and left the wall plugs at home. Not only did they not supply shower caps and lotion, the front desk claims they had no plugs for our USB cords to charge our cell phones. I am stunned at the lack of amenities here for the business, let alone casual traveler. I regularly stay at Hilton properties and have never run into this situation...very disappointed.
Manager Response: Boester,  I am sorry to hear about your disappointment in your recent visit to the hotel.  I understand your frustration after leaving your home unexpectedly.  As for the amenities, lotion and shower caps are available upon request, but we do not have USB plugs. If you find yourself a similar situation again, there are USB ports on the back of televisions that can utilized to charge your telephone.    Again I apologize for your inconvenience.  .

Summary: A month ago I booked a king suite and a queen suite for my family of 5 to stay in the first weekend in January. After driving 10 hours I called the hotel at noon to see if we could check-in at 2pm instead of 3pm. I was told, yes, our rooms would be ready. We arrived at 2pm and were told the king room was available but the queen room was not. They told me the guest wasn’t checking out till 4pm and they needed to clean room afterwards. WHAT? I was lied to on the phone when I called and you’re letting a guest stay till 4pm in a room I reserved. They told me sorry but nothing they could do about it. They would let me know when it was available. The customer service was horrible and pretty much tough cookies to me and my family of 5. Needless to say we headed to the 1 room. Turned
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback and disappointment in your recent stay.    I am sorry to hear of the challenges you experienced when trying to check into your second room.  I looked into what occurred and found that the guest who occupied your room previously was an Elite member, who was entitled to a 4 pm check out, as a benefit of their Elite status.  At the time of your original call, we were not aware that the guest would be utilizing this benefit.  Again , I apologize that no other accommodations were offered to allow your family to get ready for your event.    I would like to discuss this further, if you could please contact me at the hotel.  I look forward to speaking with you.

Summary: Always stay at Marriott as I'm gold member.  Specifically booked this one as it was close to family and stated had full gym.    Well hotel is under construction ( not mentioned on website when booked) and they have no gym, whirlpool , it's in mid construction and they are charging 7 per day to park in an empty lot.  Ridiculous   Told me I could use gym at redesence inn which I tried and is a closet with 5 dumbells.  Totally useless.  When i complained about that they told me I could go to la fitness or 24 fitness - but they I had to pay.  Unacceptable   This is a crappy property that has no right charging for parking and should be ashamed for lack of transparency on construction and amenities available as I would have never booked it.    I even tried emailing manager and got no
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just spent two comfortable nights at this hotel and found it to be typical MCY in every way.  Well placed, clean with friendly staff.  It's located in the same parking lot as a Residence Inn so that could work for you also. Either way you can't go wrong.
Manager Response: Thank you fro taking time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in Fountain Valley.

Summary: My stay at Courtyard Marriott was a necessity for work in Fountain Valley. I needed a late checkout on my last day, and they allowed me to check out at 4:00 pm which was absolutely amazing! A lot of hotels are really stingy about late checkouts, so I appreciated this fact. However, the rooms are really really rundown. The carpet was stained all over my room and there was obvious water damage in the ceiling tiles which got me thinking about the possible mold situation in this room. While i know rooms are hard to dehumidify by the beach, this room had a particular "damp" smell that was unpleasant. If the rooms were renovated at this location I would continue to come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know of your recent stay.  I am sorry for the issues you encountered during your stay.     I am happy to announce we will be undergoing an entire hotel refresh, beginning at the end of October. This will address the lobby, hallways, meeting rooms, outdoor area and all guest rooms.    We are anxiously awaiting the upcoming enhancements and look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Hotel personnel were very pleasant and efficient.  We were able to secure a room early which we appreciated.  We used the laundry facilities, just one washer and one dryer, but it was great that they were available.  We walked to a wonderful Thai restaurant but I wouldn't say that it was walking friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in was very good.  Ruby was excellent very quick and efficient. I have been traveling for 3 months on business and this was the best experience so far when checking in.  Room was spacious and clean. There was an issue with the air conditioning unit on the 2 Nd night . They sent someone to put a fan in to dry floor and take unit apart.  The only thing I found to be a little weird was at 1030 at night they knocked on the door to remove the fan and take it out of room. A bit late but I just went with it. Pool area was nice whirlpool was in a separate area which was gated good idea so no children could be in the whirlpool.  They had a washer and dryer for guests to use. Not sure why hotels feel the need to charge for parking though you are paying to stay at the hotel so why
Manager Response: Thank you for taking  time to let us know about your recent stay and for the kind words you expressed about Ruby.  We are indeed lucky to have her on our team.    I apologize for the late disturbance in your room to retrieve the fan. That does appear strange, but I will definitely bring this up to ensure it doesn't happen in the future. Thank you again for staying with us.  We appreciate your business and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: We have stayed here a few times while visiting our son and recommend it highly!  The location is convenient to shopping, beaches and all that SoCal has to offer.  It's close to the 405, but also is adjacent to quiet neighborhoods and traffic-free local streets... a real plus!  Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The pool and courtyard are nicely landscaped.  The front desk staff are great!  Our son left his sunglasses on a previous stay and Cheryl made sure she kept them safely until he could return and pick them up.  All in all, it's a nice property that offers a good value.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again.  We are so happy you had another great stay.     Thank you mentioning Cheryl.  We are really proud of her and glad she is on our team.   We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Between myself, my husband, and my children we have probably stayed here at least 30 times over the last several years. Nothing spectacular and sometimes better than others but clearly got the job done. The location was perfect for us and we like courtyards. What a surprise at check in that they now charge for parking! The lot is huge and never full. This feels like a rip off, and was probably the last straw for some very loyal customers. Let me be clear it was not the amount charged, but the fact it is charged at all. There are a lot of other newer hotels but we tend to stay with our old favorites. Probably not anymore .
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your business and are sorry to hear of your disappointment in the parking fee.  We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: We had booked a suite and found the room to be spacious and comfortable.  Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the pool: this was a pleasant place to sit with a cool drink, although it could be noisy at times due to over-excited kids.  One other minor quibble was that the cafe/bar wasn't open all day.  Having said that, we would be happy to stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We only stayed for one night recently but were very pleased. We both require two things of any hotel: clean and quiet. This relatively new chain hotel was squeaky clean and quite quiet.   Nice to have a Starbuck's in the lobby. Our stay was quite comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, beautiful lobby, clean rooms
Summary: This was my first visit to CA, front desk staff was very helpful with directions, and for our every request. Though some parts of the hotel seem a little out-dated (hallways, and some features is room) The lobby is beautiful and newly renovated. I've stayed at many Courtyards and was glad to see the service here met expectations. Two thumbs up.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked stay at Courtyard in Huntington Beach as it was on my list of hotels near Orange Coast Memorial, where I was scheduled for surgery. Everything I requested was taken care of--early check in, quiet room on top floor. Staff extremely efficient and accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay.  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: If you've stayed at one Courtyard Marriott you've stayed at them all. The decor and layout of each room is very standard across the chain. If I was to compare this hotel chain to clothing I'd call it business casual. Not fancy, not casual but good enough to get by. It's a nice and comfortable option for a short 1-2 night trip. This particular location was great. There is tons of free parking and easy access to the 405 freeway. It is only a 5 minute drive to the Garden Grove area. I would not recommend staying here without a car. There is not really any commercial businesses within walking distance. It is surrounded by many other hotels and 2 gas stations. It's a quiet area.   I stayed in a king suite for one night. The room was clean, the furniture seemed relatively new and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel lobby is inviting and our room was very clean, including a completely unstained tub, which was an uncommon and welcome find. There is a nice fitness center and a small pool and a whirlpool room. Our stay was fine and convenient to what we were there for, however, keep in mind there is no free continental breakfast or anything like that. You need to bring or purchase your food and drink, including coffee, either there, if their "Bistro" is actually open, or go off-site. The "Bistro" featuring the only food and drink on the property was closed for the day by the time we arrived at 1 p.m. on Sunday afternoon. The coffee maker in the room is the single paper cup kind, and you get 2 regular coffee packets and 2 decaf coffee packets. This means depending on what you and your
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay.  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: Centrally located, free parking and about a twenty minute drive from the beach and an eight minute drive to Trader Joe's, this was a great place to spend a few nights. Staff was always friendly and professional. There's a heated pool and a whirlpool as well as a fitness room. I would definitely stay here again when I'm in the area!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay at our hotel.  I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and would definitely return.  We look forward to welcoming you back next time you are in the area.

Summary: My wife and I have enjoyed staying at this property in the past, when visiting grandsons. The service and location has always been great. NOT this time!!  Booked three nights "Deluxe Room", which was a disabled room. Asked for a non disabled room and was told that was the only room available. Understandable, but would have been good to be told in advance or at the time of booking the room. Early this morning at 5:45 am the room above seemed to be jogging in the room.Tonight requested an extra blanket at 7:45 and had to go to the front desk at 9:10 to ask for the blanket.   As reflected in my other reviews I am quick to commend properties that go beyond normal service, this property at this time is not in that group.  For the price, we will no longer stay at this property.
Manager Response: Ronald S.   I am so sorry to hear about the challenges you experienced while at the hotel.  These service failures were unacceptable and I would like to apologize on behalf of myself and my team.  Although the room may have been the only one available at that time, I expect my team members to explore possible solutions to accommodate all of our guest's requests, to the best of our ability.    I appreciate the positive feedback you have given in the past as well as the negative.  Without this we would not be able to determine where additional attention and training is required.    I hope you and your wife will give us another opportunity to demonstrate our appreciation of your continued business and commitment to our guests. Please contact me if you would like to discuss this further.  Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice, the staff was good, but the room noise left alot to be desired.
Summary: We booked a two night stay in a 1 bedroom suite. Because I do not like a lot of noise upon check-in we were offered the 2nd or 3rd floor. I took the 3rd floor so there were no little gremlins running over head. I also specifically asked for it to not be near the street or the freeway since it is directly adjacent to the property. The front desk staff said no problem it was interior and facing the pool, so we thought this would be perfect. We checked into our room which was nice and spacious, and clean. We did not stay in the room long as the kids wanted to swim. So we did, then went to dinner. When we got back the and it was time to turn in about 9:30 we soon realized that our room # 312 had a strong noise coming from the mechanical room next door. It sounded like a washer out
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review your recent stay at our hotel.  I am sorry to hear about the noise you experienced while in your room.   I have requested my engineer investigate the cause of the noise, so the situation can be remedied as soon as possible. Thank you for bringing this to the attention of my team.  We appreciate your feedback as we strive to ensure our guests have an enjoyable stay with us.  I hope you will give us another opportunity to welcome you and your family back in the near future.

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel three or four times now when visiting the area for business.  The hotel is located in a good neighborhood and has convenient access to major streets/highways.  The hotel has a nice lobby with a convenient grab n go snack bar or breakfast area.  The rooms are sizeable and beds are comfortable although in general it just feels like a typical hotel room.  The only con I have is that each time I stay it feels overly humid in the rooms where the A/C units appear to run constantly but not do anything.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback on your recent stay.  I am sorry to hear about the humid feeling you experienced in your room and appreciate you letting us know, so we can investigate.  Thank you again.  We hope to welcome you back soon.    Regards,

Summary Heading: Beach City Stay, with Disney on the side
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend stay. It was lovely.. The property shares with the Residence Inn.  Courtyard had a nice lobby lounge/bistro.  Business Center Area and MarketPlace for goodies.   Rooms were comfortable and clean...  The area is easy access to shops, food, and entertainment... I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking time to post your review.  We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary Heading: Great location near a ton of restaurants
Summary: I liked the location and proximity to the 405 Freeway.  There is plenty to do with shopping and dining within a short drive of the property.  Everything was clean and well cared for.  The front desk staff was very pleasant and everyone couldn't have been more helpful.  I was staying for business and would have appreciated a better WiFi signal.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate that you took time to let others know of your experience.  We hope we have another opportunity to welcome you back in the near future.

Summary: Perfect for the family vacation - wonderful location with well maintained facility and courteous staff - everything is near as clean - this is my third year on the roll with the family and I can't wait for the next holiday
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean Property, Freindly Service, 24 hour store across the street
Summary: We stayed here for a wedding not to far away. No Complaints at all. Clean property, friendly employees and there is a Arco across the street open 24 hours. So obtaining snacks, beer etc... even late at night was a simple cross the street effort. The pool has lights that change every few seconds making the view from our suite a little more tropical feeling
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback of your stay.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Chose this property due to the freeway access to I-405 and it's close proximity to Huntington Beach. My wife and I were in town for the Marathon in Long Beach, but we wanted to stay where we could drive to the beach as well. This property is in good condition both exterior and interior. Our King room was just the right size and the bed was good. We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi, both were excellent temperatures and pool towels were readily available. The jacuzzi was especially nice with a nice strong jets relaxing the tired muscles after a day at the beach or for my wife running the marathon. The check in staff were accommodating and friendly, the beach is only a short 10-15 min drive down Brookhurst Avenue. The only minor negative is each day we were there we would hang our
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for taking time to provide feedback on your experience.  We are so happy you and your wife were able to enjoy the amenities of the hotel.  Congratulations to your wife for running in the marathon. That is definitely and accomplishment.    We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again in the near future.

Summary: The hotel and staff are friendly. Carpets being cleaned so all hallways and room have damp floors. This Courtyard has not had the new update as many others but it is still in very nice repair. Close to the 405, 15 min from beaches, close to shopping and restaurants.  Outdoor pool and covered hot tub. Sparse on outside seating to just relax.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in and out was quick. Employees are nice. Room cleanliness was fine, but I do think the room could be updated. Like everyone else has mentioned before, the Ac units are old. Ours felt like it made the room humid instead of actually just keeping the room cool, so we kept it off. The walls of the room were pretty thin as well. We could hear people talking and walking in the hallway. Our room was also located next to the stairwell so every time someone used the stairs we would hear the door slam which was frustrating when you're trying to sleep at 6 in the morning. Overall though our stay was fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We appreciate your feedback and use it provide on going training for our associates, as part of our continuing efforts to improve our guest's overall experience.     We look forward to our planned room renovation at the end of 2017 and to welcoming you back.

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and kids.  Not really much to say about it.  It's an older style Courtyard, though it's mostly been kept up to date.  The only things I thought were showing a little age were the plumbing fixtures, but the shower worked well, and the bed was comfortable.  The location is pretty convenient right off the 405.  One weird thing -- when we got into our room, the carpets were a little bit damp, as if they had just had them cleaned.  I wasn't quite sure how to feel about this... one one hand, eww damp carpets.  On the other, it was nice to have a room with freshly cleaned carpets, and they were close to dry by morning, and completely dry by the second night.  On balance, I didn't complain or anything, especially since the front desk had
Manager Response: Thank you taking time to provide feedback on your recent stay at our hotel.  I apologize that the room you were provided had not completely dried from the carpet cleaning and that you had to experience that during your stay.    Thank you again for letting us know.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with just a little TLC
Summary: We spent four nights in Anaheim and then another two in San Diego an finally one night in this hotel before we flew out of LGB.  We had planned to go to the beach this day so we booked something close to Huntington Beach (this hotel) and the airport.  The location of this hotel was perfect.  When we checked in we were way early and our room was not ready but they had a different room type that was available and so we took that.  We had a first floor room that opened right to the pool.  That was actually really great.  Our five year old loved that.  He was was actually so excited about that he didn't want to go to the beach!  Everything was very nice about this hotel with a few minor exceptions.  I travel a lot for work and stay in a lot of Courtyards.  I have a pretty high
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback of your recent stay.   I apologize for the issues you experienced in you room and with our pool gate repairs, that were in progress during your visit.    We are glad we were able to accommodate you with a room that allowed you and your family to readily access the pool area.  We look forward to the next opportunity to welcome you back.

Summary: Comfortable and convenient.  Room and hotel was up to date and clean and fresh.  Room smelled excellent.  Staff was friendly.  Pool didn't have Jacuzzi which was a bummer.  But room had direct access to pool courtyard.  That was nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review our property.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay.  I am sorry you missed our hot tub, located next to our gym on the back of the hotel lobby, but hope you will come back soon and enjoy it on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Tried three rooms all smelled extremely moldy. Probably from old AC units that seem to be covered with black mold.
Summary: Very moldy smell. Glad I was able to find another hotel and stayed only one nite. Good thing too because when I work up I got a major headache mold allergy reaction in my throat. After I checked out all symptoms went away within about 30 mins.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear about your experience at the hotel.  The welfare of our guests is very important to us and I have instructed our engineering department to investigate the issues you described to ensure any issues are discovered and resolved as soon as possible, to eliminate any future incidents.   Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: Stayed for business, in a non smoking hotel why were my eyes stinging. The hotel felt dirty, not what I expect at a Marriott property, not that I saw actual dirt, but when you have over 1,200 nights at Marriott properties, you just know. I would not stay at this property again. But again, great staff, very friendly and nothing was too much trouble  to make you feel good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide feedback on your recent stay at our hotel.  Providing our guests with a clean room and exceptional service is our top priority and I apologize we failed to meet those expectations.  I hope you will give us another opportunity to demonstrate our commitment to taking care of you on your next trip to the area.

Summary: I usually stay at Marriott's because they have dependable Wi-Fi service. The place be in a corner room with no Wi-Fi signal. They have no other rooms to move me too. I'm going to have to check out early in the morning and go somewhere to do business. Without Internet it's a complete waste of time. Avoid this Marriott
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide your feedback concerning your recent stay. I am sorry to hear about the difficulties you experienced trying to connect to the hotel's internet and the disruption it caused.  I assure you, the difficulty you described will be investigated to ensure proper connectivity is available for all guests.  Thank you again for letting us know.

Summary: Very nice rooms, refrigerator, coffee pot, separate bedroom, pullout sofa. The pullout was not very comfortable ,but it did the job.   The pool area was nice, nice fitness area. The food was a little over priced.   Overall very nice place to stay, good location.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide your review of our property.  We appreciate your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again.

Summary: If you need to stay in the area it's a decent place. Quiet at night, pretty clean based on my room. Breakfast spot is ok and loony is nice. I've stayed at other courtyards that were better overall. Staff are ok and if your looking to do other stuff everything is a drive. Not much in walking distance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: With family to visit and shopping to do, this hotel was perfect.  Freeway-close (with surprisingly quiet rooms), minutes from South Coast Plaza, Bella Terra, Little Saigon, and Westminster mall, around the corner from Costco, a straight shot to the beach, this was a no-brainer.  Ample parking all around the hotel, so no need to fight with your neighbor!  Very, very convenient.  To top it all, we were greeted by a free wine tasting event!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I work in Huntington Beach and this hotel offers a great location near the freeway.  The hotel serves Starbucks coffee and pastries and breakfast items in the lobby.  The hotel is clean and quiet.  Wi-fi is complimentary for guests with Elite guests receiving higher speed bandwidth.  This is a decent hotel for business travelers.
Manager Response: I am so sorry to read your comments.  Clearly we dropped the ball and did not follow through as promised.  I have personally reviewed this with each Front Desk associate to discuss what happened and how to prevent this in the future.  Wedding days can be very stressful and please accept my apologies on behalf of the hotel for adding to this stress.  I am sure your wedding was beautiful and you have great memories for a lifetime.

Summary: From the very start I had nothing but trouble with this hotel. I called for reservations because I wanted a room block. Room blocks are when rooms are blocked off next to each other, apparently not with this hotel. I was getting married down the street and thought this hotel would be great since I have never had issues in the past with Marriotts. I reserved only 2 rooms, one for my myself and my bridesmaids and one for my sister and her boyfriend because she has a newborn baby. I asked the rep several times to the to ensure my room would be right next door to my sister, she was maid of honor and needed to go back and forth from rooms for hair and makeup and to check on her baby. The rep reassured me they would be next to each other but to block the rooms I had to pay for them
Manager Response: I am so sorry to read your comments.  Clearly we dropped the ball and did not follow through as promised.  I have personally reviewed this with each Front Desk associate to discuss what happened and how to prevent this in the future.  Wedding days can be very stressful and please accept my apologies on behalf of the hotel for adding to this stress.  I am sure your wedding was beautiful and you have great memories for a lifetime.

Summary: I am a black-card-holding, lifetime platinum Marriott customer so I know whereof I speak when I say this is the worst Courtyard I have ever been to in the 18 years i have been travelling for business and staying in Marriotts.  Where do I start? It's hard to say, but lets start by mentioning that this is the first Courtyard I have stayed at in a long time that did not have a microwave. Staff is OK with that, though, because "We have one here you can come down and use." Right. I'm going to put pants on and come downstairs just to make some popcorn, not to mention being able to microwave a frozen dinner.  But I'm not going to have a frozen dinner, anyway. The closet grocery store is inconveniently located on the far side of the 405, and this hotel has no shuttle. There is very
Manager Response: Thank you taking time to review my hotel. I am sorry we did not meet your expectations. You are right, I agree that the lack of closed captioning is an ADA issue and I have shared this with the leadership team to resolve this issue for future guests.  Microwaves and shuttle service are not typical amenities offered at Courtyard hotels.  Marriott does have several brands that offers kitchenettes.  I noticed you relocated to our sister property Residence Inn and hope you enjoy your stay.  Thank you for being a loyal Marriott traveler.

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay here - the bed was very comfortable, the room was ok-sized... wifi worked great.  I liked that the bistro served hot snacks and breakfast in the morning with a good selection of items to choose from.  The fitness center was adequate with a full set of dumbells, a bench and a couple of cardio machines.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed a couple of nights at this Courtyard and entering the lobby, it was noticeably a Courtyard Hotel.  I like the familiarity of this brand and the hotel looked fine.  Our room was a little small, but overall ok.  We were on the first floor with easy access to the pool, though we had problems with the screen door to access the pool from our room.  (Just a nuisance, not a big deal).  I believe the pool was heated and there was a separate section for the sauna.  We utilized the lounge area with our friends and it was convenient.  The staff was very courteous and helpful.  Parking goes around to the back, which makes it easier access to the rooms at the back of the hotel.  Overall, we had a nice stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I liked staying here ,except this time,  the bed, which they said was new when we complained about them being in bad shape hurting our back. Of course I had paid for the room with credit card points so they told me I could only get a snack from the convenience Center they had for my issue. I didnt see how $2 was compensation. I thought that was bad service especially since I was a rewards member with them as well. The brunch we got was a little pricey too. The lobby and room was very nice. Close to freeway and many things. I stayed here for the price, rewards and nearest to my family. I may stay elsewhere now.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older Courtyard with basic amenities. It could use an overhaul, but our room was clean and met our needs for a family of three. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The location is near the freeway, but you can't hear the traffic. It is convenient to many area attractions. The price is moderate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older Courtyard but it did not lack on anything as far as comfort and great customer service. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were very quiet even though I was streetside. I would be glad to stay here again next time I am in the area
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient choice for business in nearby Costa Mesa
Summary: Stayed here on business for meetings in Costa Mesa.   Consistent, typical experience as with other Courtyard properties.    Pros:   - Clean, quiet  - Comfortable beds & pillows  - Convenient to freeway   Cons:  - Fairly limited dining choices nearby
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the fifth Courtyard that I've stayed in this year.  I can usually count on Courtyard hotels to be clean and well-kept.  Not this one.  This Courtyard is in need of some TLC.  The carpet in our room was so dirty that we decided to cut our stay short and we checked-out earlier than we planned.  I couldn't help but think "If the carpet is this dirty, what else isn't being cleaned."  Although the hotel is close to the 405, it was much quieter than I expected (except for the noisy air conditioner that woke me up each time it came on).
Manager Response: Thank you taking time to review the hotel.  I am sorry we did not meeting your expectation and rented a room that had unacceptable carpet.  I have shared this with the leadership team to resolve this issue for future guests.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel a few times. It is close to the freeway and down the street to some good shopping. This hotel never disappoints. You don't have to leave the hotel to eat. There is a very nice bistro with a very awesome decor. You can order breakfast and dinner there. The staff is super friendly and helpful.There are only 3 floors but the hotel is a very nice size. I noticed a very nice size conference room. The pool area was very nice as well. Very restful stay for me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.

Summary Heading: Courtyard by Marriott Huntington Beach Fountain Valley - Nice Stay!
Summary: I had the opportunity to stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Huntington Beach Fountain Valley while in Orange County this week. Excellent location with the new Courtyard design including the Bistro, a nice addition. Great staff with a well designed lobby and nice room. Always Great!
Manager Response: I am glad to see your stay was good.  I will share this with the team!  Thank you

Summary: The hotel was located very conveniently off the freeway, so access was easy. We asked for a room facing away from the freeway, and we did not hear any road noise. The room itself was on the small side, which was fine, but the sink/vanity/coffee area was very small, and it was not really possible to have more than one person in that area. And if someone was coming out of the bathroom into the sink area, there was the possibility of getting whacked with the bathroom door if you were accessing the little refrigerator at the same time. As with other Courtyards, there is no complimentary coffee or tea in the lobby, which is a shame, and breakfast is not included. There is a rather pricey bistro in the lobby, though, so you can buy a $4 cup of coffee and a $3 muffin there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts.  I am glad we were able to be in the perfect location for your trip.

Summary: ...and so it was perfect for this type and category of hotel. Very friendly service, even when my room lights didn't work properly at night and help was needed.  Spend even some time at the little pool which was used by some parents with their kids.
Manager Response: I was glad to read that we met your expectation for hotel needs.

Summary: Last week, I held a meeting in Conference Room A for my company.  Everyone, from sales to the event manager, helped me plan this event with patience, diligence, and attention to detail.  Adriana, the event manager, was very attentive upon our arrival.  Setting up the room went smoothly, they provided pitchers of water, glasses, pens, notepads, and a whiteboard.  A HUGE plus was the fact that we were able to bring food from an outside vendor and serve it at our meeting.  Bathrooms are situated close to the meeting room, which was air conditioned, spacious, clean, and well taken care of.  It was with such ease and courtesy that my company was able to hold an efficient meeting.    Forgot to mention, we get free wifi!  Thanks Courtyard Marriott FV!
Manager Response: I am so glad everything worked out for your meeting.  I have shared this with my entire team and the sales office.  I know everyone works hard to make every guests experience special and it is nice to see such positive feedback.  Thank You

Summary: Good: Easy access near the freeway, close to Huntington Beach.  Furnishings are attractive and decent.  The breakfast is not included in the room rate, but a good café is located in the lobby.  Not so good: There is a pervasive locker-room smell in the hallways and in the rooms.
Manager Response: I am glad that we could accommodate your travel needs.  I have forwarded this to maintenance so they can look into the odor issue.  Feedback is always helpful and only makes us a better place.  Thank you for taking time to let us know about your stay.

Summary: Stayed here recently while visiting family. Good location and close to freeway. Excellent place to stay for a long period (over a week) and you can really get comfortable. Love the breakfasts and afternoon snacks.
Manager Response: Great to see you enjoyed my hotel.  I am glad you found it comfortable.  I will share your comments about breakfast with the Bistro team.  They will be thrilled.

Summary Heading: Short overnight stay in Huntington Beach
Summary: Stayed here overnight on business.  Room was nice, clean, everything you'd expect from a Marriott.  Staff was "okay," not overly friendly or not.  So why a 3 star review?  Frankly, I almost forgot to write a review about this hotel, because it was so forgettable.  The hotel left little to no impression on me, one way or the other, so I felt that a solid 3 was the most appropriate.  Bottom line, if you are looking for a convenient, reliable, hotel, and primarily need a quite place to sleep, this is a good option.  If you're looking for something more, you'd be unlikely to get anything more than a good room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay.  I will share this with the hotel team and use it as a tool for continued improvement.  I always appreciate feedback and want to thank you for your time.

Summary: Nice clean roomy hotel with decent prices. The location is pretty good. Right off the 405 freeway close to the beach. Only problem is that the 405 traffic is terrible in that stretch. Almost seems to be there 24 hours a day!!  Free wifi is serviceable. I was able to get 0.7-3 mb/s download speed depending on time of day. Parking is free. Service is good enough.  Rooms show signs of age here and there but are clean and well kept.   I would stay there again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  The 405 is a very busy freeway and it always backs up in the Fountain Valley area. I have the pleasure of driving on it every day!  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and the room was clean.  My team works hard to make everyone’s stay the best.  Thanks again.

Summary Heading: We were here for my wife's surgery at nearby Orange Coast Medical Center
Summary: Location was excellent.  They offered special rates for hospital visitors.  Staff was always friendly and anxious to help, especially when I was delayed past the dinning hour and they were able to provide for me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  I am glad we could be a place of rest during this stressful time.

Summary: The one evening stay at your hotel was by far the worst night we have had in years of travelling. The hotel itself is dated and in dire need of an update. But the room itself was horrendous. Small in size, stains, not just small, but large stains on the carpet made us reluctant to walk barefoot across it. The mattresses were so old and weak, it was as though we were sleeping on the box spring itself. The beds creaked and moaned with every move. Loud creaking mind you. Then there was the noise...........Constant yelling and screaming from the pool area until about 10:00 pm, and then the pounding on the door and screaming from someone trying to get into a room several doors down from us...........Someone beating on the door yelling the f word profanity to open the door and let him
Manager Response: Sorry to hear about your experience at the hotel.  I have forwarded this to all departments for review and create an action plans.  We take your comments seriously and will use them to improve for the future.

Summary: We stayed here for one night during my daughter's weekend soccer tournament (held in Huntington Beach). It was a good location, friendly staff, room was roomy enough for 2 adults & 1 child, pool and sitting area were nice. Would love it if they had outside heaters or a fire pit to warm the bones. Overall, a nice stay.
Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your stay at the hotel and it worked well for your team.  Your tip is right on.  Unfortunately, the Courtyard can amplify sound which is why we try and close the pool area at 10 pm.  Good luck on future games!

Summary: Went to this location & I wanted a room.  I was given a quote and asked what if I had my military ID.  The clerk (can't remember her name) said "well if you have ID, then you can get the rate at.....Her attitude towards me caused me to go to another location.  I am a miltiary service person and of course I'd present my ID.  That rude encounter sent me to another location.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments.  I am not sure why asking for an ID was considered rude.  You had requested a rate that requires qualification and the front desk agent was just explaining the process.  I am sure their intentions were not to hurt feelings, so please accept my apologies.

Summary: The beach is not in walking distance.  It takes two hours to walk (and you have to be careful around the 405) but there is a bike path the whole way. The room was good.  The treadmill was in good repair when I wanted an early morning run.  There is a cafe/bistro type set up in the lobby which is expensive but nice if you are tired after a day or working or walking.  It was too cold to enjoy the pool but the deck had a comfortable set up for enjoying the sun. The staff was great and suggested a great park about a mile down Brookhurst with an exercise path.
Manager Response: Thank you for spending time reviewing the hotel.  Yes, walking over the 405 freeway can be tricky as car coming off are not looking for pedestrian and drive pretty fast.  Sorry if you were under the impression we were closer to the beach.  It is 6 miles to Huntington Beach State Beach and 8 miles to Huntington Beach City Beach.  As an alternative, Orange County Bus has a stop right outside for the bus that heads toward the beach.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel, but on noisy street
Summary: One of the things I love about courtyard is that no matter what city you are in they are pretty much consistent and you know what to expect. While it's not a boutique hotel, it is always designed well and the rooms are nice and clean.   Pros: The room of course clean. Beds are nice! Decor not super updated, but still nice and contemporary. Plus every room has a pull out sofa. I like that it has a fridge and really nice counter space above the fridge  you to buy snacks and such. I love that places like this has a kitchen downstairs. Great place for breakfast and of course starbucks coffee. This hotel is located right next to the freeway so access to and from is awesome and you will get to most places fairly easy because of this. There is plenty of grocery stores and places to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts.  I am glad you enjoyed you stay.  Sorry you felt the room was too small.  I can certainly understand that traveling with a small child had different requirements.  We do offer rooms that are twice as big.  They sell out quickly, but you can always ask about availability.  Hope to see you again if your travels bring you into this area again.

Summary Heading: Ok hotel with ill thought access
Summary: I stayed at this hotel in April of this year because it was very close to the business I had to visit.  Getting into the property is a major reason that I would most likely pass on the points from Marriott & not stay there again.  If you are coming to the hotel off of Slater Ave from the East to the West, you have to make a left into the property shortly after going through a stop light @ Brookhurst St.. This would not be an issue if the oncoming traffic coming towards you could be seen for 1/2 mile or more.  However,  the road of oncoming traffic is coming down a small hill & not a flat road,  which you cannot see past.  Also, these opposing drivers are coming @ fast speeds & although they may have to stop at the light ahead (Brookhurst St), they don't slow down.  Therefore,
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts.  The placement of the driveway, stop lights and street design is approved by the city of Fountain Valley and changes are not being considered at this time.  I certainly understand how frustrating it can be when dealing with Southern California traffic.  Heavy traffic in front of the hotel is usually timed with the beginning and ending of the school day, as Fountain Valley High is just over the hill.   I was happy to see the room was clean and the facilities met your needs.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a business meeting
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights to attended a business meeting. This property is very quite, great service and a clean comfortable room. Check in was a breeze and service at the hotel cafe/bar was great. No issues, great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review.  Courtyard’s original design was to target business travelers and we keep changing to meet those needs.  I will share your comments with the staff at our next meeting.  Again, thank you.

Summary: Our group was extremely satisfied with our stay at this hotel.  The staff was very pleasant and accommodating.  The Courtyard Marriott offers a delicious breakfast, pool, and lounge area.  Adriana Reynolds was great to work with.  She helped answer all our questions and I would definitely book with her again.thank you Courtyard Marriott!
Manager Response: I am very proud of my staff and glad your group was taken care so well.  Your comments go along way and I will share them at the next standup meeting.  Thank you.

Summary: A very convenient hotel for my visits to visit family in the area. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with plenty of amenities. Our stay included a breakfast and coffee in the bistro. The food was good, the coffee hot, and the service was quick.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at my hotel.  I am glad we met your expectation in cleanliness and service.  I loved the comments about the Bistro food and service.  As Mr. Marriott always said, hot food hot and cold food cold.  Thanks again.

Summary: Great from desk staff spacious rooms and very clean. In a great location right off 405 5 miles from the John Wayne Air port, Cons no free coffee in the lobby breakfast very good but expensive for small portions dinner ok but not that great but there are a lot of great restaurants in the area
Manager Response: Thank you sharing comments about the hotel.  I am glad the service at the front desk was good.  Sorry to read about the Bistro.  I will share this with the team and use this as an opportunity for improvement.

Summary: Again, "thank you Courtyard and Staff....Hotel very clean; staff very welcoming in every way.  Great location and so close to many things to do.  Also within walking distance of some  good restaurants, stores and easy acce3ss to freeway
Manager Response: What a great way to start the day!  You are welcome.  My team works hard to make everyone’s stay enjoyable.  I will share this with them at our monthly celebration.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: My Favorite Place to Stay in OC
Summary: We stayed here for 5 night  Jan/15, the place was clean and well maintained just off 405 Freeway,The staff  was outstanding and polite and helpful, I have to give a shout out the bartender for her great service,We will definitely be returning!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing.  I have posted your comments in the Bistro so we can all give our bartender a high five.

Summary: I stayed here on business and found it serviceable.  They do not offer free breakfast but have a "restaurant" in the lobby.  It's really a counter where you can order food.  I didn't eat anything from here so can't comment.  There is a gas station across the street that sells some convenience food items.  The room and property was clean.  The air conditioner was very noisy, and leaving the window open was problematic due to the closeness of the freeway.  There are a number of restaurants within a mile or two, and Huntington Beach was about a ten minute drive.  The hotel itself is on a very busy intersection so not the most walkable area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share comments about your stay.  I read all comments posted on line and share them with the staff so we can make improvements or celebrate success.  I am glad your stay was good and invite you to return the next time you are in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Basic Courtyard, okay for business trips
Summary: This courtyard has undergone the transition to the new "business traveler" friendly.  Rooms have ben updated as well as the lobby area.  Work out center is very small and has very few machines.  My biggest complaint is that they now charge for everything.  Used to really enjoy walking downstairs for a cup of coffee and paper in the early morning.  Now the coffee is $5.00 Starbucks.  The breakfast is very expensive for what you get so plan to go out to eat.  Not sure how the Residence Inn next door can be lower priced and include free breakfast?????
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about Courtyard.  The Courtyard brand has never offered free breakfast as part of the amenity package, however, many Marriott brand do, such as Residence Inn.  Marriott has a selection of brands at different price points and services to allow the traveler to match one to their needs.  My apologies that your experience at this Courtyard did not meet your expectations.

Summary: The pictures on the website make this place look much nicer than it is.  The bar/restaurant was minimally stocked with maximum price points. We passed.  The pool and hot tub were standard.  The lounge chairs had nice padding tho,  so that was appreciated.  The rooms are standard.  Clean,  well cared for by the room attendants. We paid considerably more to stay here than other hotels because it seemed nicer when booking online.  But there was nothing around,  so we had to drive everywhere too. This place was just ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for your perspective of the hotel.  I am sorry we did not meet you expectations. I have shared this with the staff and we will use this as a tool for improvement.  The Bistro was designed as a fast casual concept, with limited choices to expedite service.  You are correct, this hotel is located in drive market, with very few places to walk.  However, we are centrally located to most Orange County attractions that can be reached in a few minutes.  Again, I appreciate your time and comments.

Summary: An older Courtyard property (thinking about it - are there any new ones?), but well kept.  All staff I interacted with were super friendly and professional.  Only six miles from Santa Ana (aka John Wayne, aka Ontario) airport.  Short drive (about 7 miles) to the Huntington Pier too.  This hotel would be at the top of my list on any future trip out here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great comments.  Yes, there are new Courtyard hotels opening all the time, one of the newest just opened at the Irvine Spectrum, about 15 miles south.  But my hotel is still the best location for the Huntington Beach area.  Look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip.

Summary: Yes, some of the other reviews about friendly staff are true.  The front desk people and the restaurant staff are super nice, but things stop there. Cleanliness of the rooms are about average for the courtyard chain, but the rooms are tiny!!!  I don't think I have ever stayed in a room so small in the U.S.   We had a King room with a rollaway bed for the kids. After we brought all of our luggage in, we could barely get around between the beds and the hallway.  Furthermore, the rooms are a bit dated.  I don't think they have been updated in quite a while. The hotel is literally right on top of the 405 freeway, and the rooms are surprisingly well soundproofed.  But in the middle of the night, you can still hear the big rigs and motorcycles going by. There is no complimentary
Manager Response: I appreciate your time to let me know your thoughts.  The staff and I review all comments and act to resolve issues within our control.  We do have rooms with two beds that are a little bigger and work better for families.  They are very popular so we could have been sold out of those when you visited.  Again, thank you.

Summary Heading: THE MOST FRIENDLY STAFF I HAVE EVER MET
Summary: Thank you Courtyard Staff.  We were visiting Huntington Beach to volunteer for Samaritans Purse, Operation Christmas Child Shoebox.  The clerk noticed our shirts with the logo.  She told us that she had read an article about a couple and the shoebox story.  She actually looked up the article and when we got back that evening and envelope was under our door with the article.  As for the hotel it is very clean in all areas.  I love the outside patio that has comfortable  chairs to relax in.   This hotel is just of a busy highway, however the outside noise in the room was barely noticeable.   As always it's a Marriott and the beds are always great.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words.  I loved reading about your experience and was so proud of my staff.  You were here for a very worthy cause and I am glad we made your stay comfortable.  Thank you again.

Summary: Very clean and friendly Courtyard.  Great location with easy access off of the 405.  Quiet w nice breakfast.  We stayed here to visit relatives in Huntington Beach and to go to Disneyland. Worked great.  We would stay here again. Nice commons area too.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review.  It means a lot to me and my staff that you enjoyed your stay.  I have shared this with the team at our last stand up.  Thank you for the encouragement and hope you will stay with us again when you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced & Conveniently located for Our purpose
Summary: We spent three days here in December 2013.  We have family and friends in Huntington Beach and love to spend time eating and shopping in Little Saigon so this location serves its purpose.  Staff is friendly, service is above standard and the property is nice.  There's even a Starbucks in the lobby for those who love Starbucks.   Good for families with kids.
