Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice comments.  I am glad you enjoyed the hotel and the surrounding communities.  Little Saigon is a fun place to visit and to enjoy great Vietnamese food close to the hotel.  Hope to see you on your return visits to the area.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel-- Would definitely stay again
Summary: I recently booked a room here very last-minute and was quite pleased with the hotel.   THE ROOM: I got a room with a king size bed, and the room had plenty of space to set up the pack and play we brought for my child to sleep in. The room was very clean, comfortable, and relatively quiet. It looked like the room had recently been redecorated with tasteful, modern furnishings and carpet. It had a sliding door straight out to the parking lot, which was very convenient as we were packing up to go, especially with a child.   LOCATION: The location can't be beat. It's 10 minutes from Huntington Beach, right off the 405, and 10 minutes from the Pacific Coast Highway. Thanks to the hotel's proximity to the PCH, we were able to easily visit Newport Beach, Laguna, San Clemente, and other
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and comments about your recent stay.  I am glad you enjoyed the hotel and your experience was good.  Hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: I stayed at the Fountain Valley Courtyard for two nights while on a business trip.  Everything was clean and the hotel is well-located for Orange County visits.  The front desk staff was also incredibly helpful in suggesting how to spend a few hours of free time.  I'll be back!
Manager Response: I am so glad you enjoyed your stay in Fountain Valley.  My team works hard to make sure everyone has a great experience and will want to come back.  Thank you for your nice comments and we look forward to your return.

Summary: We didn't think twice about booking since it had the Marriott name, but we were disappointed when we got to our room.  We found dirty towels on the floor when we walked in, and the carpets were so filthy.   There were huge stains, and we didn't feel comfortable walking without shoes on.  We went down the next morning, and the staff was fabulous.  They were so kind, and switched us rooms, and even gave us free breakfast.  The next room we were in was better, but not by much.  It seems the whole hotel could use new carpet, because the hallways were bad as well.  The beds were fair.  The bathrooms had dirt in the cracks, and were outdated.  Overall I wouldn't stay here again.  I would have given the hotel a 2 star if it wasn't for the staff.  They were great.  :)
Manager Response: Thank you for posting this review and sharing your feedback with us. Please accept our sincere apology for the cleanliness issues that you encountered. We will address your concerns so that we can ensure an exceptional experience for all of our guests.

Summary Heading: Ritz Carlton Service with Marriott Pricing
Summary: I had the most amazing experience with the Courtyard Marriot in Huntington Beach.  After a very long day of working, I asked Eddie where I could refill a few 5 gallon water bottles.     Eddie immediately volunteered to fill them for me!  That type of service is hard to come by!   In fact Eddie insisted that he help me by filling the bottles.   Her further explained..."This is my home and I want you to feel at home in my house!"  WOW  An hour later I realized that I forgot my cell phone charger.   I called down and Michelle answered the phone.  Michelle informed me that if I was willing to leave my cell phone with her overnight, she would use her personal cord to charge my phone.  AGAIN...GREAT service.  The next morning, I ran into Ashley and asked about my cell phone.   Ashley
Manager Response: Wow, what great comments about my staff.  I really appreciate you letting me know how well you were taken care during your last stay.  It makes me proud to have them as part of my team.  I have shared this with the entire staff as a great example of Marriott’s Spirit to Serve the Guest.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great customer care and spacious room
Summary: I stayed at the hotel on September 6 -7 and was so very pleased by the pleasant greeting I received at check-in by staff Eddie and Alison at the front desk.  They made me glad I had pick their hotel to stay the night at.  Also the room was very spacious and nicely furnished.  I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: What nice recognition of two of my staff members.  I am very proud to have them as part of my team.  I will be sure to share this review with the entire team and add my thanks as well.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel with my niece in mid-August. The service was outstanding. After flying in from the east coast, and having a 3 hour wait in LA to get our rent-a-car, we arrived at this hotel very tired and cranky. Eddie at the front desk, was so friendly and helpful, and immediately offered us a free coffee and an early check in. Every morning, and every afternoon he greeted us with a smile, and gave us fantastic directions to everywhere from Disneyland to Newport and Laguna (his directions were almost always faster and more accurate than the gps.) Ashley at the front desk was also fantastic, and suggested we use Groupon to purchase tour tickets instead of paying full price, something I never wouldve thought of.  I cant say enough good things about the staff here. They
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments.  Sounds like your trip to get here was tiring and I am proud that my staff welcomed you so warmly.  Look forward to welcoming you in the future.

Summary: The only reason I can't give 5 stars is because the property is a bit dated, BUT, don't let that fool you. I've stayed at several Marriott properties, mainly Courtyard, and I'd have to say the staff at this location were the friendliest I've ever encountered. From the front desk staff, to the housekeeping staff, to the Bistro staff - all extremely professional, courteous, and accommodating. All my requests were honored with no hesitation and delivered with a warm smile.   We stayed this past weekend (9/6-9/7) in a king suite. I asked for a corner room on their 3rd floor and was very pleased with the room. Yes, it's a bit dated, but it wasn't a throwback to the 80's or anything - all the room needed was a newer furniture. window dressings, and a wall thermostat instead of the old
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful comments.  I am glad you enjoyed the room and it was comfortable and clean.  The Bistro and Starbucks are great additions to the hotel so I am happy you had the chance to have breakfast with us.  Look forward to having you visit us again in the future.

Summary: This hotel was very nice. It was clean, quiet, and just what we needed to help us further enjoy our vacation in the area. The staff are all nice. Its in a good spot where you're not too far from all the attractions of huntington beach and orange county.
Manager Response: I am very happy you enjoyed your visit to our hotel.  We work hard to make sure your stay is the best.  I will make sure to share this with the staff at our next meeting.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and we absolutely loved it! We got a king size bed with a pull out couch for our daughter all of which were comfortable! The tv stations that were offered were great and we ordered pizza from one of the places they mentioned in their booklet and were pleasantly surprised at how good it was. The only thing is I wish they had vending machines or cheaper drinks because the drinka were limited in what they had to offer at their little market and they were completely over priced. We will definitely be coming back again!
Manager Response: I am very happy you enjoyed your stay and had a great weekend.  My staff works hard to make everyone’s stay is as pleasant as possible, and it is nice to hear positive comments.  I will share this with the team at our next daily meeting.

Summary Heading: Not up to Marriott Courtyard standards
Summary: My husband travels frequently for work,  we travel  for vacation and my son's soccer tournaments. I also was a travel agent for 15 years.  So we are fairly familiar with various hotel standards. We typically stay at Starwood brand, but secondarily will stay at Marriott. This property was below the Marriott Courtyard standard. I rarely if ever have written a negative review , you can look at my reviews and  they are usually positive. However, I felt compelled to write this review and let the management know that this property is in serious need of improvement.    Firstly, the carpet was absolutely filthy and desperately needs to be replaced. Even the upholstered chair is black on arms. Standard amenities such as luggage racks, TV channel guides were missing from the room. When we
Manager Response: Thank you taking time to share your experience.  Based on your review, we did not live up to your expectations or our own.  Let me apologize on behalf of the entire hotel for your stay.  Your comments about smoking in the courtyard are very valid and something we will need to watch carefully and make any necessary changes.  It is comments such as yours that will help us become better in the future.

Summary: The carpeting in the hallways and room were so  filthy that the bottom of my husband's socks turned black. However, the bathroom and vanity sinks were clean. The pool was nice too, but I wouldn't stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment concerning the hotel.  I am truly embarrassed that your room carpeting was not clean. .  It has been a very busy summer, and I am sure carpet care was put on hold.  I have already pulled housekeeping and maintenance together and asked them to go room by room to inspect condition and schedule professional cleaning.  Hopefully, you will try us again on your next trip to the area.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights and we had great stay. It's a big, spread out property, lovely grounds and nice little pool. Typical Courtyard, good wi fi, we took advantage of laundry which was $1.50 per wash and dry, friendly service but the best part was the location. Few blocks down Brookhurst street is Starbucks, Ralph's, Applebee's etc. The only thing that tick me off was the Starbucks coffee that hotel was selling in the lobby for more than what it cost at Starbucks but it was nothing like the Starbucks coffee. There's only few things worse than week coffee in my book so this put quite a dent in my morning. Other than that, our stay was good, staff are friendly and polite and I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about the hotel.  I am glad the location suited your needs.  Accept my apologies for the coffee.  I contact the Starbuck service department and did some trouble shooting and found some hard water buildup that was causing the brewer to malfunction.  It has been fixed and I have not heard any other issues since.  Hope to see you again when you travel to Orange County in the future.

Summary: I checked into to the hotel after 10 on Friday the 11th of July without advanced reservations. They had only two remaining rooms, both double queens. The one they gave me was a handicapped equipped room. When I woke up in the morning I was covered in flea bites. I put my bags in my car and went back in to talk to the manager, passing two different families leaving the back door with dogs. When I showed the desk clerk the flea bites he said he would adjust the bill. I had paid $165 and he took $100 off.  I asked if they allowed dogs in all the rooms and he said dogs weren't allowed at all. When I told him I had passed dogs leaving the hotel, he just said, "Well, they aren't suppose to be there."  So paying $65 for a flea bite hotel is about right.
Manager Response: First let me apologize for your experience at the hotel.  After you spoke with the front desk agent, my manager placed the room you had been in as out of service and called our pest elimination company.  They came out and did an inspection.  There was no evidence of fleas or any other pest in the room.  The hotel is not pet friendly, but must allow service animals to accompany guests.  Our cleaning protocol requires us to treat all rooms that service animals have been in whether there is evidence of fleas or not.  During the summer months, it is not uncommon to be in contact with fleas or other pest while at the beach or enjoying other outdoor activities.  While we can’t pinpoint the cause at this time, I am sorry you did not have a pleasant stay.

Summary: We picked this property because it was close to an event we were attending, and we were surprised and delighted by what we got for the money. Bed was comfortable, room was well appointed, grounds were neat, and you can't beat the location. This will definitely be our go-to hotel for our OC visits!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice comments.  I am glad you enjoyed the hotel and look forward to welcoming you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nothing overly impressive and what I expected.
Summary: I booked this hotel for two nights due to the location because I needed to stay in Fountain Valley. This hotel is within driving distance to the beach and it is close to a few food places. Parking is free and I believe the internet is also free at this hotel although I did not use that.  I had stayed at a different Courtyard the night before so I was able to compare this hotel to the last one. This hotel seemed older and the beds were not as comfortable as the night before. The check-in here was also easy and there is also a bistro and snack area at the hotel. I know there were pools and a workout room but I did not get to use the facilities.  The room we had also had two beds and the room was fairly large like the other hotel, definitely enough for two people with carry on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to rate my hotel.  We are exactly as stated, a basic hotel, clean and friendly, at a reasonable price.  I am glad your trip was good and welcome you back if ever in this area again.

Summary Heading: Pleasant and comfortable stay, friendly staff, good value for Orange County.
Summary: Conveniently located near John Wayne, just off the 405, but far enough away that traffic wasn't a factor. The staff was friendly and accommodate, check-in/out quick and the rooms were pleasant, clean and comfortable.   The room had a great place to work and relax, Starbucks in the am and high speed internet (for a fee), but worth it.   I would definitely stay at this location again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to rate my hotel.  I am glad your stay was pleasant.  We work hard to make every guest happy and we love to hear from our guests.  Hope to see on future trips.

Summary: The front desk personnel is excellent.  I stay at this hotel at least once a month and am always greeted with a smile. The check in process is fast & efficient. Ashley & the manager, Steve, provide excellent customer service. This Courtyard is conveniently located by the 405 freeway and many restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay.  It is always fun to see your name mentioned in such a great comment.  I will share this with Ashley as well.  We all work hard to make sure your stay is the best.  Thank you for choosing this hotel and we look forward to you next visit.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times due to its location.  Huntington Beach and Newport Beach are not too far away, but it definitely isn't next to the ocean if that is what you need.  This is why the rate is reasonable.  The lobby area was remodeled and it is quite nice.  The hall carpets seem older as well as the hall ceiling which still has the popcorn texture on it.  Also, the rooms don't seem to be remodeled and that is evident by the bathroom tub/shower as well as the uncomfortable bed.  If you get a room near the freeway, it can be loud with the traffic.  The staff is friendly and the breakfast food/drinks are good.
Manager Response: Thank you spending time to rate the hotel.  Marriott hotels generally run 6 years between renovations and we are getting close to that time frame. I agree that popcorn ceilings are so 80’s.   Good news is I just got approval to replace all of the mattresses so I will be working on that over the summer.  Look forward to welcome you in the future.

Summary: The hotel is easy to get to from the John Wayne airport. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The pool area is nice. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. This hotel was in a safe location and near other attractions
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay.  I am glad you found the hotel clean and safe.  We work hard to maintain the property and appreciate your comments.  Look forward to welcoming you in the future.

Summary Heading: Small rooms, hard bed, convenient location
Summary: We were looking for something near family in Huntington Beach and booked this hotel.  It is right off the 405 freeway and Brookhurst.  Easy to get around to the beach and near family.  The hotel common areas were worn and need sprucing up.  Carpets were stained and needed vacuuming.  The room itself was clean, modern and had everything we needed but the way it is situated it was very small compared to other Marriott hotel rooms.  Hotel staff are always nice and friendly.  No breakfast included but there is a small cafe with breakfast items.  We didn't need the breakfast so were not upset by it.  Paid $129 for a King room. It was a fair price for a holiday weekend.  I need to say the bed was way to hard.  We are Marriott Vacation Club owners and stay true to the Marriott brand
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay.  It is always good to hear good and not so good comment, it helps us get better.  Good news is I just got approval to replace the mattresses.  I will be working on this project over the summer.  We are also just beginning to discuss the next renovation and I am excited about the new look Courtyard has designed.  Until then, we will continue to keep the room and all areas clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Location is central to everything with a great staff and value
Summary: You feel like the staff is part of your family and that they really care about you.  This location is very central to much of the LA area.   It s a very good value without having to cut back on anything.
Manager Response: Thank you spending time to rate the hotel.  I am glad your stay was good and you find our location convenient to many of the fun things to do in the Los Angeles/Orange County area.  Looking  forward to having you return in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice new lobby, room was a little dated, but clean
Summary: Ok, so they remodeled the lobby and it was worth it, saw a lot of people hanging out there. Checking in was painless and the staff was friendly. I was using a Marriott e-certifacte so the room was free and perhaps I paid a price for that. Was give a room directly across from the elevator. Room was small, in fact I almost broke my toe in the middle of the night, walking back from the bathroom. The couch left on 12 inches or so between the bed to walk by and get into. Paint peeling in the ceiling of the shower. Also, I've notice in my last few stays at a Marriott, my Silver Elite "Priority" late checkout has only gotten me an extra hour, which I imagine anybody can get if they ask. All that said, not much better in Fountain Valley.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I apologize regarding the condition of the ceiling in your bathroom. I will share your experience with our maintenance team so that we can address the issue right away. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: I paid $173 for a solo traveller.   The hotel is clean, modern(ish), staff are friendly , and there is WiFi. In general it is a decent place,but for a room costing that much the least I expect is for breakfast to be included in the price. What kind of hotel these days doesn't do this? It's so standard across the world.   There IS a bistro in the lobby where you can get something to eat, so the least the hotel can do is provide some kind of voucher to their guests. The bistro is over priced too, by the way.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at my hotel.  I am glad that the room was clean and comfortable.  The Courtyard brand has never offered complimentary breakfast as part of the room price.  However, there are many options under the Marriott umbrella that do include breakfast in the rate, i.e. Residence Inn, TownPlace Suites and SpringHill Suites.  Hopefully, this will help with future hotel choices.

Summary: We spent two nights here while at the Surf City Marathon.  The hotel was very nice.  Great pool and hot tub.  The employees were friendly and had already arranged for us to have late check out and a taxi for me to get to the race start.  The room was nice and comfortable.  We would stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you such positive comments about your recent stay.  I am glad the hotel met your needs while in Huntington Beach.  The Marathon has grown significantly over the past few years so we are constantly learning how we can take care of the runner best.  Late check-out and transportation seem to be key, so I am glad this worked out for you.  Maybe we will see you next year!

Summary: Pros - nice staff, clean environment, amenities are good, beds are comfortable, the staff allowed me to park and leave my business's trailer while I was away.   Cons- no free breakfast, although the hotel was non smoking the smell of cigarette smoke permeated the 2nd and 3rd floor halls. The lobby snack bar thing  was over priced with a boring menu. Go down the street and you can find every Resturant available to suit your tastes. Like most hotels the TV had limited channels. Bring your own Wifi I was not sure how the hotel wifi worked there were no directions that I could find.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to rate the hotel.  I am glad that the room was clean and comfortable.  My apologies that there was smoke smell in the hotel.  Marriott has been smoke free since 2007, but there are always people that challenge that rule.  We do charge $250 when evidence is found that someone has smoked in the room.  We do have complimentary Wi-Fi in all rooms and public spaces.  There should have been instructions on the desk for your reference. I am sorry if this was missing.   I will follow up with housekeeping to make sure this isn’t overlooked in the future.  I hope you will consider us again in the future when your travel brings you to this area.

Summary Heading: OK - but it could have been nicer
Summary: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business. At first glance, it was OK. It was a little outdated, but it was fine for one night. Bed was soft and overall, the room was clean. My main issue was the faucet leaked, the hair dryer did not work (not good when you have long hair and count on hotels to have a working one in the room), and it was almost impossible to watch the tv at the angle it was from the bed. It was crazy.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  I have showed this to housekeeping and maintenance so that the items you mentioned can be corrected.   The TV is on a sliding tray that swivels, which I find helpful when watching from bed.  I hope you will try us again the next time you travel to Orange County.

Summary: We booked this hotel as we were going to a funeral and it was the closest with available rooms.  We arrived at this hotel and our initial though was it was okay a little outdated but satisfactory.  That night we pulled out the sofa sleeper to find out it was broke.  We had to sleep on the floor.  The blanket had something on it that made me super itchy.  The floor had some chemical that made it where I couldn't breathe so I spent most of the night in a chair.  I was told the bed however was quite comfortable.  The property was almost sold out when I booked and the one bedroom suite was the only thing that would accommodate four of us.  My mother-in-law is a smoker and was careful to make sure she smoked outside.  In the morning we noticed a sign outside that said the hotel has
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at the hotel.  I have spoken with the Assistant General Manager about what happened last weekend.  It is my understanding that you and your party did not report to the front desk that the sofa bed was broken.  We do have rollaway beds available which we could have easily brought to the room until the sofa bed could be repaired.  This would have also solved the problem of sleeping on the floor.  We do use cleaning solutions and several methods to keep the carpets clean.  Also general wear and tear on hotel carpet is higher than at home so I would agree that sleeping on the floor is not the best alternative.   Marriott has been smoke free since 2007.  It is stated on all key packets that ‘We are committed to a smoke-free policy.  A $250 room recovery fee will be charged for smoking in your room”.  Housekeeping reported smoke in the room and it was confirmed by their supervisor.   The sign you refer to on the entrances to the hotel is to comply with Prop 65.   You can find this sign or similar warnings on most public buildings in California.  I hope I have been helpful in clarifying some of your concerns.

Summary: So, I stayed here last night. The guy I'm dating sadly had a pipe bust in his house and the water had to be shut off so we decided to get a hotel rom for the evening. I only chose this hotel because it was close. I WAS IMPRESSED! Emily took very good care of us, was super sweet on the phone and in person… The lobby was modern, clean, and very cutely decorated! ( not to mention there is a snack bar, cold drinks and snack wall with a cute bar!)Our room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable! It was an emergency reservation and it was handled beautifully . Thank you again for taking good care of us! Fabulous service, friendly staff, clean and close if you live in HB, and not far from John Wayne Airport! :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the positive feedback. We are glad you were so pleased with our accommodations and we’ll make sure to acknowledge Emily’s great service at our next Employee Stand-Up meeting. Please come visit us again soon!

Summary: Pros:  -Clean -Modern -Located right off the freeway -Friendly service  -Free Parking -Free Wifi  Cons:    -Felt a bit over-priced at $150/night -Hate the way Courtyard Hotels put the TV to the side of the bed, rather than in front of it!
Manager Response: Happy New Year!  Thank you for your comments, your feedback is very much appreciated. I'm glad you enjoyed you're stay with us and hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: My daughters and i had to make a trip to CA.  we stayed 2 night and the room was clean and quite.  our only issue was not being able to open the window (which should be able to) and i guess it was that big of a deal because we never informed the front desk that we had a problem. the lady that checked us in was not very friendly but efficient.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. We strongly encourage our guests to inform us of anything that may be wrong. This way we are able to correct it right away and ensure you have a great stay. Otherwise, I’m glad to hear you and your daughters enjoyed yourselves. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: it was quiet, that was my main concern
Summary: I thought for the price, a few amenities would be included. continental breakfast at least.  the bed was stiff. the TV was in a odd place,  it seemed like it could use some upgrading.  the back door lock was broke, which concerned me, stayed open all night, anyone could of come in. I felt like the staff was a bunch of high school kids and no one was in charge. No one seemed to be very helpful or wanted to spend time talking to the guest as much as each other, I had to ask for everything. Several times. I may not  be familiar with the hotel  now a days, but, they don't show you to your room anymore, or show you how the TV works, how the  heater works, how to even get to the elevator to find our room. had to walk all the way around the building to get help . you have to call for
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: Good value, central to SNA and Huntington Beach
Summary: Nice decor, clean rooms, and pretty grounds. Breakfast in the bistro is good quality at a decent price in a short time. Rooms are quiet, bathrooms are updated and the bed was comfortable.  I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your pleasant comments.  Our ultimate goal is to make our guests feel comfortable and provide an enjoyable and efficient stay. It’s pleasing to know that was your experience here with us and hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Close to Beach, Usual Quality of Marriott
Summary: Booked this hotel to be close to Huntington Beach for July 4th holiday.  You could bike to beach from this location or easily take a bus too.  We enjoyed the pool which is on the small, intimate side.  That room was what you expect from the quality of Marriott.  This hotel also had a bar and grille in lobby, but it has set hours.  However I came down looking for an espresso coffee and I found that the cafe was closed, not opening up for a few hours.  the front desk person offered to make the coffee for me.  It was great!  Will definitely stay again.  Lot's of stores and restaurants nearby and right off the 495 freeway.
Manager Response: I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Though we always want you to feel comfortable enough to relax on our property, it’s nice you were satisfied with our local surroundings as well. We have cross trained our associates to assist in making Starbucks coffees throughout the day and we are glad you could experience that during your stay. Thank you for sharing, and hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Exceeded my expectations for a Courtyard!
Summary: Most of us stay at a Courtyard because we know it will provide a predictable experience at a mid-range price.  There's nothing wrong with that - and it's a model that is clearly working for Marriott.  However, I spent last weekend at the Fountain Valley Courtyard with my family during a beach-cities soccer tournament - and the experience really exceeded my expectations in many ways.  While the hotel looks like "just another Courtyard" from the outside (clean, tan and well-maintained) - the inside has been completely redone and is very contemporary and stylish.  Lots of great lobby seating, numerous large screen TVs and an open-concept restaurant/bar that was very inviting.   The food at the hotel was refreshingly good and freshly prepared.  The salads had crisp greens - and the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments! I agree, the hotel renovation has made a very positive impact in the guests experience and I'm glad you were able to enjoy it. We strive to provide exemplary service, so you can expect the same on your next visit!

Summary: This is a nice hotel in a really good location for the beach and other OC activities like Disneyland etc. Our room was really nice. We got the King suite for 20 extra bucks including the stay for breakfast. More about that later. Our room was two rooms although the living room was fairly "tight". Once the hide-a-bed was opened the desk became useless and I actually moved the chair into the bedroom so we could squeeze by. All in all the room was nice, fairly updated and quite clean. The bathroom was lacking a fan, which is odd. It had a small fridge and microwave, which was convenient. The pool was good, not so large and didn't have a board or slide but kids seemed to enjoy anyway. The breakfast was really good. It was hot fresh and large servings if you’re hungry. They also have
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. It makes us happy to hear our guests are able to take full advantage of the facilities we have to offer as well as our surrounding locations. We are glad you all enjoyed your stay, and hope to see you again soon.

As I was roadtripping for a show in HB, my business partner and I stayed at this hotel. I WISH WE NEVER DID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I left my hat on top of the closet bureau, and checked out at noon. I called back and spoke to a gentleman, who actually has done the most (i think) of everyone I have spoken too so far. He checked lost and found, and went to the room and said he didnt see anything but the room had been cleaned. So the next step would be to talk to housekeeping because that is THE ONLY PERSON WHO HAS BEEN IN THERE SINCE WE

I wish we could have been more help recovering your baseball cap.

Summary: From the time we arrived to the time we left, everyone, even the back of house staff was friendly, and said "hello".  There wasnt that feeling of stressed out employees nor any lack of care. A true sign of good management!  Accomodations were comfortable, clean and modern.  Of course Starbucks coffee is great to have too.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind words. It is important to remember our duty in providing a delightful ambience for our guests, so we are glad that was your experience here with us. I hope we see you again soon!

Summary: Lobby was best feature of hotel with good staff and adequate menu choices for snacks and breakfast.  Halls are dimly lit and gloomy.  Rooms are a but out of date with mismatched couch cushions.  Exterior door key cards not functional. Piled laundry in halls in evening was not appealing.
Manager Response: Thank you kindly for your review. Our staff here prides themselves on delivering the best service possible. Although there were a few things not to your liking, I assure you I will speak with the appropriate departments to adjust accordingly. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: This is a nice quiet and comfortable hotel. The pool was very nice, I swam in the morning and the pool was heated to a comfortable temperature.  Food bar has limited choices, but what we ate for breakfast was good.  comfortable beds.
Manager Response: Thank you for the pleasant review. Everyone does their best to ensure every facet of our guests stay is efficient and enjoyable. We hope you will return to visit us in the future.

Summary Heading: Rooms B, Gym C, Service A
Summary: I stayed at this hotel in May.  The hotel was conveniently located near a business meeting.   The rooms are furnished well but are very noisy (recommend that you ask for a room facing the courtyard and not the traffic-busy road.)  The gym was *very* disappointing - basically a very small with pretty much nothing in it.  Please add at least ONE bike to the room.    The reception desk was very good and the service people are very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments. I understand what you mean, since our property was built over 20 years ago when gyms weren’t as popular as they are now. Unfortunately, due to ADA requirements, we are not able to add anymore equipment in the exercise room. However, your feedback is appreciated and we do hope you come back to visit us soon.

Summary: This Courtyard is in a good location to lots of restaurants and activities in the Fountain Valley area. The Bistro was excellent and the staff was excellent. Very friendly. My room was clean and comfortable. Got a great night sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your nice comments.  We work hard to make all of our guest’s stays great.  Hope you will choose us again for any of your future needs.

Summary: We spent 8 days in the hotel and had virtualy no complaints. The staff were very friendly and efficient. I requested some extra towels and within a few minutes there was a knock at the door...very impressed! They have a nice pool area and a separate jacuzzi area too. Very relaxing. We would have liked a grill for cooking out on the premises though. All in all it was a very nice hotel and we would stay here again if ever back in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the great comments.  I am so happy you enjoyed your stay at the hotel and in Southern California.

Summary Heading: Great value for business or pleasure
Summary: This hotel is located convenient to the coast of Huntington Beach or Newport Beach and is also close to the heart of Orange County.  Well maintained, comfortable and friendly staff.  Very good choice for affordable business or pleasure travel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are doing business in the area this is a very good hotel.  It's easy to John Wayne Airport, right off the 405 and there are enough food places around - some within walking.  The hotel is clean and is a typical new style Courtyard with the breakfast counter.  It's about 6 miles to the beaches - but it is a straight shot to get there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: a mere 12 minute drive from SNA.  has the new version lobby with information screen and numerous flat screens scattered around.  rooms are older with new flat screen tv.  has cable with the irritating lag when changing channels. separate vanity with sink outside of the shower/lav room. my unit had a mini frig.  hvac system was quiet.  I had first floor room near catering office which was nice and quiet. easy fueling options nearby to fill your rental car and close enough to airport that you can make it there without refilling. did not see any dining options near but easy to find up the interstate.  Room was clean and comfortable, good mattress but pillows need replacing  - had to use two to get the loft I desired
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent three nights in this facility. My wife is recovering from a broken hip, so we booked the Handicapped Room. The shower floor was flat for easy access, but as a result, the entire bathroom floor flooded every time we showered, and several towels were wasted in drying up the flood. The room was relatively clean, but the rug needed a shampooing. The bed was comfortable, and complementary wi-fi was available and easy to use. The staff was polite, and we had no complaints. We would come back.
Manager Response: none

Pool was small, but decent for a little lounge time during my work weekend. The front desk staff was friendly as was the bartender on staff one of the nights. The carpet in my room had several stains, always gross to see in any hotel. Also, I'm consistenly dissapointed with the comforters at the Courtyard- but that's across the board for the brand.  I'd stay here again as I normally stay near disneyland and it was nice to be away from lots of families and children so I could get a good night's sleep.
Manager Response: none

Undoubtedly the worst maintained Marriott we have ever encountered.

Summary: Is a little nice hotel however we stayed on the first floor and it could be pretty noise in earlier in the morning it was room #164 next to one of the side entrees of the hotel the entrance to the pool. The staff is very friendly and the girls at te coffees hop are great .
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review.  I am very proud of the Bistro  (coffee shop) associates as well.  They continue to be one of the top rated teams for service.  I will pass along your comments.

There are small booths that seat maybe 3-4 each with an individual TV; these are very convenient when  waiting for someone to get ready.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I am glad the suites work out for you.  I agree, a room with a half wall isn’t a real two room suite.  Hope to see you next year as well.  Remember, if you come over the holidays, book early as the suites are very popular.

Summary Heading: Not very clean, but ok for the price.

Manager Response: Please let me apologize for the cleanliness issue you encountered at my hotel.  I am completely embarrassed that you found the sofa bed in that condition. When you have a chance, could you email me that information at cy.snafc.gm@marriott.com.  Again, my apologies.

Summary Heading: OK hotel because of the price but not much else
Summary: I stayed for one night on a business trip and this hotel was OK. Its biggest selling point was the price: it was relatively affordable compared to other hotels in Orange County. But its location isn't convenient: you'll be driving to go anywhere in Orange County. The rooms were OK and somewhat modernized but the rest of the hotel looked old and felt deserted. Wouldn't stay again.

Summary: There are a number of hotels by the ball fields in this area - stay at a different one!  When we're traveling for sports, our expectations are pretty low, yet this hotel could not even manage to meet those.  The staff was indifferent, the room was tiny, the ice machine was constantly re-filling itself outside our door.  Between the ice machine and the freeway traffic on the otherside and the comatose staff, we could have stayed somewhere a lot less expensive.

Summary: Stayed here when visiting relatives.  Typical Courtyard, mostly clean, good service, affordable rates.  We have a king suite, which is really a bedroom and separate living room with a foldout couch.  Good when the kids didn't want to sleep on the relatives floor.  We were only there at night to sleep, quiet and comfortable bed.  Only complaint was that seems a fair number of smokers sat by the pool in the evening, wafting their poison up toward our window (we prefer fresh air to A/C, so it was open).  Also, note this is really in Fountain Valley and not HB.  Your a good 5-6 miles from the beach.  Tradeoff is it is way more affordable than any of the hotels at the beach, but you either have to drive down or hop on your cruiser for a nice workout.

Summary: This is a very nice hotel for the price.  I especially liked the fact that although it did not include breakfast in the rate we were charged, you could opt to include it if you wanted.  I did not try or see what was offered for breakfast but the $20.00 additional charge hardly seemed worth it.  You can get a heck of a breakfast for that right down the street.    The location is great for nearby shopping and restaurants.  They do have a restourant that opens at night but, there again, we did not try it so can't give a review on that.  Unless you are completely without transportation, I would suggest you use the nearby eateries.    The pool, exercise room and hot tub were great. Summary: I will admit that I'm a Hilton fan, but I will write this review as non-biased as possible. The employees were extremely friendly and upon arrival to my room I realized the remote was missing, and they had it up to me within a few minutes. The hotel was fairly clean, but the rooms didn't have the cleanest smell. I probably wouldn't stay here again if I was in the area, but it was fine for the one night that I needed it.

Summary Heading: Like a second home to us
Summary: This is our favorite place to stay in the area and we stay here fairly often.  It is so comfortable.  We do miss the buffet breakfast they used to have but love getting Starbucks in the lobby.  The rooms are super comfy and the pool area is really great.  I've taken my kids here before, too, and they had so much fun.  This last visit, we moved to this hotel from another horrible one that I never should have booked in the first place but I did because it was much less expensive.  What a mistake that was!  This hotel is perfect and dependably comfy.  Great, highly professional staff.  Love it!
Manager Response: Thank you for such positive comments about my hotel.  I am so glad your family enjoys the amenities such as the pool and Starbuck’s Coffee.  Courtyard as a brand is moving away from the breakfast buffet concept and adding the Bistro. There is also a kid’s menu available when they travel with you.  Again, thank you for choosing the Courtyard in Fountain Valley and I hope to see you in the future.

Summary: My friend and I stayed here this past weekend and I just don't think it's a good value. The rooms were very small, but I can handle that.  It was the filthy carpeting that will keep me from ever staying at this hotel again. It was so dirty that our feet were black after walking around for 10 minutes!

While the lobby is certainly beautiful and a nice place to use internet, the rooms weren't any better and there isn't any free breakfast included.   I would suggest save some money and stay at the Residence Inn if this is the location you need.

Found women's underwear on the floor of the room upon entering. Signs very poor for elevators and restroom location. I got everything I needed.
